title: Network Forensics for Lateral Movement
description: After a breach, a forensics analyst must analyze network logs to trace the attacker's lateral movement across the network from the initial point of compromise.

tasks.description: Identify the initial point of compromise from previous analysis.
tasks.expected_outcome: Analyst has the starting point for the investigation.

tasks.description: Analyze firewall, DNS, and authentication logs originating from the compromised host.
tasks.expected_outcome: Analyst reviews all relevant network logs.

tasks.description: Create a timeline and map of the attacker's movement, showing every host they connected to and the credentials they used.
tasks.expected_outcome: Analyst produces a complete map of the breach, identifying every system the attacker touched.
